Articles.Content:
A mod interaction I may spend more time debugging, and am listing in case anyone else can help me diagnose:

The settings panel - that is, the <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS panel in the <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> view, but not in the other views - appears blank.  Just a heading, and empty space, no way to edit the settings.  This does not occur with a clean install of just <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> and Squad, so it's a mod interaction - I may spend time chasing it down, but if anyone else is seeing it I'd appreciate the help.  (We could at least cross-reference mods and see what we have in common - though I run a very mod-heavy install.)
I've seen this once before... is it consistent, or does it appear if you leave and come back?

...And now that I've finally gotten around to mentioning it, the issue disappears.  Obviously I've updated something, but I hadn't checked that I'd still see this in the last couple of days, and with 1.4.2 being recent I'm still updating a half dozen or more mods a day.

![:rolleyes:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_rolleyes.gif ":rolleyes:")

[@RoverDude](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/105198-roverdude/)  

I have a suggestion, if you don't mind. Could a future version give a penalty for loneliness? (e.g. X number of kerbals feels lonely if isolated from others for Y amount of time). This would balance habitation a bit, at present, lots empty seats or multipliers is a bit overpowered.

[@dlrk](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/60033-dlrk/) do u know this:

<iframe allowfullscreen="" data-controller="core.front.core.autosizeiframe" data-embedcontent="" data-embedid="embed7201936811" scrolling="no" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/155313-141-kerbal-health-112-2018-03-14/&&do=embed"></iframe>

it has penalities for lonelyness and a much much more

but i dont know if the compatible
I'm sorry if this was asked before but does this mod need to be reconfigured if I use it in rescaled games, considering travel times might be longer.

> 
> 
> 9 minutes ago, AntoniusCDXXXII said:
> 
> 
> I'm sorry if this was asked before but does this mod need to be reconfigured if I use it in rescaled games, considering travel times might be longer.
> 

Really depends.  IMO if you're going to a larger scale, harder life support is part of the challenge

> 
> 
> On 06/04/2018 at 2:22 AM, DStaal said:
> 
> 
> ...And now that I've finally gotten around to mentioning it, the issue disappears.  Obviously I've updated something, but I hadn't checked that I'd still see this in the last couple of days, and with 1.4.2 being recent I'm still updating a half dozen or more mods a day.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> ![:rolleyes:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_rolleyes.gif ":rolleyes:")
> 

I've had the same issue. IIRC, I found that it will appear properly if you go to the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr> and add a crewed part. You don't need to actually build anything, just place a crewed part and leave the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr> again.

Hi [@RoverDude](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/105198-roverdude/)! I ran into a <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> install issue. Tried contacting <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> first and they said you maintain your own bundles. The problem is that installing <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> LS and dependencies from <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> doesn't work - you never get the green cube in the toolbars. Installing all components manually works fine.

Thanks for maintaining this great mod ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

> 
> 
> 2 hours ago, Tyko said:
> 
> 
> There's a problem with the current <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> install of <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> LS (v 0.9.0.0, Max KSP version 1.4.9). When I install it and its dependencies manually it all works. When I let <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> install <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> LS doesn't work - the green box doesn't appear in the toolbar in the space center view nor in <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr>/<abbr title="SpacePlane Hangar">SPH</abbr>.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> I've tried this multiple times with no success using completely new installs of KSP to avoid any conflicts. 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Please take a look if you have time.
> 

The metadata for that mod and all of its dependencies is maintained by the mod author; the <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> team can't change it. Sounds like there's some difference between the bundled dependencies and the corresponding standalone releases.

[@-MadMan-](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/22353-madman/) the version of your <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS install would be helpful.

It is also polite to other members of the forums to put sizable chunks of copied text into spoiler tags.

Just checking--I have only <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS installed (no MKS etc.) and it looks as if Homesickness is disabled, is that right?  The <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS "Life Support Setup" GUI in the Space Center view doesn't list a "NoHomeEffect" or any other Homesickness variables. And there's no homesickness value shown in the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr>/<abbr title="SpacePlane Hangar">SPH</abbr>.  BUT the "Life Support Status" GUI in the Tracking Station view, and the in-flight view both show "Home" durations for each crew member.  However, those Home durations don't seem to align with the calculation described in the <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS wiki, i.e., 30 days plus the maximum habitation value experienced by the Kerbal...  Maybe the calculation changed since the Wiki was last updated?  Is there a handy dandy spreadsheet for Homesickness anywhere?

Hey all, I have a weird issue on my current science mode game. Latest game version and latest <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> Live Support Version installed. I am using the 2.5 meter command pod for three kerbals plus a hitchhiker with a crew of 3 kerbals. In the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr> the habitation time is shown as 200+ days and in flight it goes down to about 17 days. What am I doing wrong. I try to go to minmus and 7 seats including hitchhiker for three kerbals is not enough for the complete journey.

You can find screenshots of the LS window in the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr> and right after launch. The Supplies time is down because recyclers do not run, but the difference in habitation time is weird to me.

[https://imgur.com/a/iTuEv05](https://imgur.com/a/iTuEv05)

**Edited <time datetime="2018-05-01T16:44:48Z" title="05/01/2018 04:44  PM" data-short="6 yr">May 1, 2018</time> by ObiVanDamme**
[@ObiVanDamme](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/136329-obivandamme/) - did you turn on habitation on the hitchhiker and command pod?

[@RoverDude](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/105198-roverdude/) I did not know that this is something that needs to be turned on. maybe that helps. 

Let me check real quick.

Of course that helped. Maybe I need to takea closer look at the documentation next time. thank you very much and keep up the good work.

So, a question...

For really long trips (10+ years) using large motherships or colony ships, is there an optimal ratio for the storage of supplies to mulch to fertilizer?  It seems like perhaps supplies and fertilizer storage should be the same amount, with mulch only being 10% of supplies.  Mulch would launch empty, fertilizer would launch full, and supplies would launch with a 10% loadout.  This is assuming no <abbr title="In-Situ Resource Utilization">ISRU</abbr> fertilizer production en route - if fertilizer production is a possibility, then it would seem to make sense to increase the mulch storage.  

How do other <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS aficionados do this?

[@Norcalplanner](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/112223-norcalplanner/) - Assuming you have sufficient greenhouses/recyclers, you really only need just over a day of supplies - the rest can be in the form of fertilizer since you just need the initial feedstock.  Though I'd probably toss in a larger supply tin to be safe in case a converter shuts down, etc.

This might be a silly question; but what's the best way to track how much life support we actually have when we send a ship with fert/recyclers/and agro - the LS statistics panel shows my kerbals time at something like 7 days (didn't bring many initial supplies), but I THINK I have enough fert for my long duna trip, and that time is going up instead of down since production > usage currently.

[@RoverDude](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/105198-roverdude/) I know someone maybe asked this but I looked and didn't find, I know that the 0.1 updates make little difference for part mods, but would <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS work in 1.4.3?

same question for mks
Yep

Again, sorry if I'm missing something - does the status window not take into account the Nom-o-matic?  I just sent my fist base to Duna on a new save using LS from the beginning, and it's only showing my supplies that I brought.  I loaded up a big tank of fertilizer, a couple recyclers, and my colonization dashboard (under Kolony inventory) is showing 0 supply usage as expected as production > usage - but under LS status window, it's only showing 66 days.  Kolonization inventory shows 102 years of fertilizer though?

> 
> 
> 7 hours ago, mavric1298 said:
> 
> 
> Again, sorry if I'm missing something - does the status window not take into account the Nom-o-matic?  I just sent my fist base to Duna on a new save using LS from the beginning, and it's only showing my supplies that I brought.  I loaded up a big tank of fertilizer, a couple recyclers, and my colonization dashboard (under Kolony inventory) is showing 0 supply usage as expected as production > usage - but under LS status window, it's only showing 66 days.  Kolonization inventory shows 102 years of fertilizer though?
> 

the LS dashboard only updates when the vessel is in focus. all other times it uses "best guess"

> 
> 
> 20 hours ago, mavric1298 said:
> 
> 
> Again, sorry if I'm missing something - does the status window not take into account the Nom-o-matic?  I just sent my fist base to Duna on a new save using LS from the beginning, and it's only showing my supplies that I brought.  I loaded up a big tank of fertilizer, a couple recyclers, and my colonization dashboard (under Kolony inventory) is showing 0 supply usage as expected as production > usage - but under LS status window, it's only showing 66 days.  Kolonization inventory shows 102 years of fertilizer though?
> 

Yeah, I think the LS dashboards only shows projections which include fertiliser while in the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr>. Once in flight you'd have to look at your consumption rate of fertiliser to make a calculation.
